messages.title: Local Afghanistan veteran Tim Hallam is the best candidate for Broxtowe
messages.content: Tim Hallam grew up in Bramcote and joined the RAF when he was sixteen years old, spending the next decade working as an aircraft technician. He was twice decorated for service in Afghanistan, where he was responsible for fixing and dispatching Harriers, often under fire from the Taliban.

messages.title: Have hope. Britain is a wonderful country full of decent people. Our future can be bright.
messages.content: Who says you have to accept Theresa May's cold, mean-spirited vision of Britain? Who says you have to settle for a bad Brexit deal that will cost jobs and put up prices? Who says you have to settle for run down schools and hospitals? Vote for Tim Hallam and the Liberal Democrats to change Broxtowe’s future.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: A say on the Brexit deal
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Calls for a final say on the Brexit deal, allowing the British people the option to reject it if it's not what they wanted.
Suggests being honest about NHS funding and raises the idea of an extra penny on Income Tax that can ONLY be used for the NHS and social care.
Strongly oppose Conservative wealth tax giveaways and would spend £7 billion to give struggling schools the funding they desperately need.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: An end to the housing crisis
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Proposes radical plans to solve the housing crisis including tough penalties for owners of long-term vacant properties and penalised land hoarding developers funded with direct government contracts where needed.
Intends to maintain the triple-lock on pensions, ensuring that they continue to grow in keeping with inflation, wages, or 2.5%, whichever is highest.

Believes in a greener, sustainable future and an end to disastrous, financially suspect, and environmentally irresponsible development. Opposes fracking and risk to Broxtowe and will promote clean energy and a transparent process.

leaflet.personalStatement: Tim Hallam served as an aircraft technician in Afghanistan and was decorated for his service. After leaving the military, he has worked at Bombardier in Derby as a senior engineer and now runs his own manufacturing business.
